component.name: GlassFrame
component.description: Centered glassmorphic overlay frame for modals and focused content.

useCases: Wrapping modal or dialog content with a frosted glass effect
Creating visually elevated overlays for focused interactions
Presenting authentication forms or onboarding steps in a floating frame

commonPatterns.name: modal-wrapper
commonPatterns.description: Wrapping a Card inside a glass frame for modal-like presentation

commonPatterns.name: auth-frame
commonPatterns.description: Centered login or sign-up form overlay

antiPatterns.scenario: Using GlassFrame for inline content in page flow
antiPatterns.reason: It is fixed-positioned and centered on the viewport — not designed for in-flow layout
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Card for in-flow content containers

antiPatterns.reason: Stacking fixed overlays creates confusing z-index and interaction issues
antiPatterns.alternative: Use a single GlassFrame with composed content inside

slots.children: Any ReactNode content to display inside the glass frame

parentConstraints: Renders as a fixed-positioned overlay at z-50; should be at the root of the component tree or in a portal

responsive.mobile: Centered on viewport; child content should handle its own responsive sizing
responsive.desktop: Centered on viewport with backdrop blur and glass border

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Delegates to child content; add focus trap if used as a modal
accessibility.screenReader: No semantic role by default; wrap content with appropriate ARIA if modal
accessibility.focusManagement: No built-in focus trap — implement if used for modal patterns

rules: GlassFrame is fixed-positioned and viewport-centered — do not use in page flow
Add an overlay/backdrop behind it if used as a modal (it does not provide one)
Implement focus trapping externally if used for modal interactions
Uses CSS custom properties: --bg-glass, --backdrop-blur-glass, --glass-border for theming
Child content should include its own background (e.g., Card) since the frame is semi-transparent

aiHints.context: Use GlassFrame for decorative glassmorphic overlay effects, typically wrapping a Card or dialog content. It provides the outer frosted glass border and backdrop blur. For standard modals with built-in accessibility use AlertDialog or Sheet instead.
